citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
One of the main active protocols that the IACUC approved to renew and continue in 2023 lists number of animals
proposed to be used in 2021 and 2022 but wasn't clear on how many are approved for use in 2023. In reviewing total
animal use for 2022 up to the inspection date, it does not appear that the facility has surpassed the approved number of
animals for 2022's total use, however the protocol should be clear on how many animals are proposed for this year.
Having clearly stated proposed numbers of animals to be used and a clear rational for how many are needed helps
ensure the amount of animals used for a study are minimized. To ensure appropriate animal use, the IACUC must ensure
that study proposals are clear on how many animals will be used with a rational for the numbers proposed prior to
approval.
***Correct by 3/24/2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
End Section

narrative:
2.31(e)(1) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
One of the main active protocols that the IACUC approved to renew and continue in 2023 lists number of animals 
proposed to be used in 2021 and 2022 but wasn't clear on how many are approved for use in 2023. In reviewing total 
animal use for 2022 up to the inspection date, it does not appear that the facility has surpassed the approved number of 
animals for 2022's total use, however the protocol should be clear on how many animals are proposed for this year. 
Having clearly stated proposed numbers of animals to be used and a clear rational for how many are needed helps 
ensure the amount of animals used for a study are minimized. To ensure appropriate animal use, the IACUC must ensure 
that study proposals are clear on how many animals will be used with a rational for the numbers proposed prior to 
approval. 
***Correct by 3/24/2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
End Section
